Description: Papyrus, ritual text, with vignette at lower edge.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 110.

The amulet Papyrus British Museum EA 10732 is written for the protection of Amennakhte, born of Tarekhânou, against the srf-inflammation (fever). The text is very close to P. Chester Beatty VII verso 7, with some variations in text and images. A partial doublet of P. Chester Beatty VII, verso 7 has been published by Yvan Koenig (Papyrus Deir al-Médîna 42). The nature of the relationships between P. British Museum EA 10732 and P. Chester Beatty VII, verso 7, is discussed. The amulet EA 10732 offers a case quite interesting study, in that it reproduces, to some notable variations, a text as present in the model note consigned to P. Chester Beatty VII, verso 7 (EA 10687), of which a partial doublet exists on a third papyrus (PDM 42).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381291) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381291)
Donnat 2000 / Le Papyrus-Amulette British Museum EA 10732 et le Billet Modèle P. Chester Beatty VII, Verso 7 (1.15)
